intro: Centella obtriangularis, commonly known as the three-angled centella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with three triangular lobes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has small white or yellowish flowers. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
